page.title: 01Pinvin and Peopleton.
page.content: The villages of Pinvin and Peopleton lie on gently undulating{fenland,}with a fine view of the Malvern hills to the West, and Bredon Hill to the South. The land is fertile and is used mainly for arable crops and for the keeping of livestock. The fruit farming influence of the{Vale of {Evesham}is also apparent as there are several orchards in the locality. Both Peopleton and Pinvin exhibit a contrast in building styles. Timber-framed houses with thatched rooves and white painted wattle and daub walls stand out from the post war developments. Both villages have been "filled out" with modern houses and bungalows. Peopleton is a nucleated village with a definite centre whereas Pinvin's ribbon development has made it a rather straggly village.
